notesStmt.note: Folio 24r contains a narrative on Moses, probably inserted here by the scribe (not in other versions of the same treatise).Two leaves, folio 156r-157v, are appended, containing fragments on the computation of various eras by Muhamad ibn Abi Bakr al-Farisi, written ca. 16th century.The fly-leaf at the end, folio fse001r, contains a small part of the commentary of Rashi on the last chapter of Deuteronomy. Afizi ben Shalom ben Yosef ben Zekharyah, writing for Se῾adyah ben Shalom, Daṿid ben Shalom and Yosef ben Shalom, inscribed in the colophon, folio 155v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: First part of Midrash ha-gadol on Exodus.

collation.p: 15 full quires of 10 leaves each, plus an imperfect quire 16 at the end. Signed with Hebrew letters on the last and first page of a quire.

binding.p: Post-1600. Black buckram. Spine title: 'Midrash on Exodus. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1482.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 24 November 1877: inscribed, folio [159v].
